actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on November 15, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mrs. Ramirez moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 225
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 198

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7409 — "To amend the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970 to waive the requirement for a Federal drilling permit for certain activities, to exempt certain activities from the requirements of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 245
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 199

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8446 — "To amend the Energy Act of 2020 to include critical materials in the definition of critical mineral, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit to H.R. 8446 and passage of H.R. 8446, if ordered, and the question on the motion to recommit to H.R. 7409 and passage of H.R. 7409, if ordered.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 7409, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Stansbury demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Stansbury moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 7409.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409 and H.R. 8446. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409, and H.R. 8446 under a closed rule, and provides for one hour of debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1568. H.R. 7409 — "To amend the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970 to waive the requirement for a Federal drilling permit for certain activities, to exempt certain activities from the requirements of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 8446, the Chair put the question on the motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Stansbury demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Stansbury moved to recommit to the Committee on Natural Resources.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 8446.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409 and H.R. 8446. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8932, H.R. 7409, and H.R. 8446 under a closed rule, and provides for one hour of debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1568. H.R. 8446 — "To amend the Energy Act of 2020 to include critical materials in the definition of critical mineral, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignation of the gentleman from Florida, Mr. Gaetz, the whole number of the House is 433.

The House received a communication from Representative Gaetz wherein he resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective on November 13, 2024, and does not intend to take the oath of office for the same office in the 119th Congress.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on November 13, 2024, at 3:38 p.m.: That the Senate passed S. 2581.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 14.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Michael Guest to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
